page.title: 06ICOMB PLACE, ICOMB
page.content: Icomb Place is a manor house.It was built in the 13 century & finished in the 15 century.The garden had 1 head gardener & 7 under gardeners.In the wood has badgers,rabbits & squirrels. Mr. & Mrs. O'Shea, the owners, have a pet swan,Siggey, & 2 kittens.They have lived in Icomb Place for two & a half years.On the gate post's at Icomb Place are sphinx.The first room we saw was where the servents sleeped & watched for enemys.The second was the banquiting hall with shields on the window sills & lances over the fire place.The next was a chapel & they were making it up.Out side was a little yard.On the front were battlements,you had to have permision by king Edward III to have them.The knight who owned the house was knight John who is barid in Icomb church.
